item.title: Diet is endogenous to exercise
item.description: There is a near-consensus that diet is more important than exercise, at least for aesthetics. I think this idea suffers from a similar problem as that suffered by ‘calories in calories out’: although it might be true in some idealized sense, “calories out are endogenous to what is eaten”. Here, diet-in-reality is largely determined by ’the kind of person you believe yourself to be.’ Exercising more makes it easier to see yourself as the kind of person who takes diet seriously, and therefore improves diet.

item.title: Natural talents
item.description: Roasting marshmallows. Calf strength (when standing). Seriously, I can do ~900 pounds through a full range of motion for 10-12 reps. Confidence (but not competence) for public speaking. Confidence for hosting events that might fail. It’s interesting that most of these ’natural’ (by which I mean occurring without practice) talents are (1) almost entirely useless and/or (2) challenging to teach.

item.title: Perfect Day
item.description: The 4th of the famous 36 questions for falling in love is: “What would constitute a ‘perfect’ day for you?” On September 10th, 2023, I attempted to live out my answer. Invitation The message to friends read, with minor edits: Please only attend the parts of the day that speak to you, and RSVP if you will join any part of the day! I am expecting some activities to be popular, some activities to involve only me, and for ~no-one to attend everything!

item.title: Optimal workout split
item.description: You’ve transcended beyond the novitiate aches of weightlifting, mastering the discipline to endure 4+ sessions weekly. Now, how should you best split exercises across days? My answer is: use the posterior-anterior split. One day for the muscles used in a deadlift (back, hamstrings, glutes) plus biceps, one day for more-or-less everything else (chest, front- and side-delts, triceps, quads, hip flexors). Here’s why. The goal We want to train muscle groups as intensively as possible, as frequently as possible, whilst not training the same muscle group within fewer than 48 hours.

item.title: Fitness advice for someone exactly like me
item.description: I’m occasionally asked for fitness advice. (Credentials at the end.) Here it is, with one small caveat: for best results, you should be exactly like me. I am not promising methods that fit most people’s goals! My advice might be helpful to the extent that you: Care about appearances at least as much as other fitness goals (health, flexibility, strength, etc.). Are happy to do non-weightlifting sports no more than twice per week.

item.title: My favorite passion fruit products
item.description: This list is a work-in-progress. In descending order of preference: Passion Fruit - agua de maracuya This “Passion Fruit” is a smoothie place in La Condesa (CDMX) that sells, among other treats, passion fruit juice by the bucket. My favorite passion fruit product of all time! I love that it isn’t too sweetened, and that the seeds have separated from the juice. The only problem is the large blocks of ice that they put in the buckets.
